article_title: Final September Consumer Sentiment Index Rises to 87.2
article_text:
Consumers’ enthusiasm about the U.S. economy improved in late September, suggesting worries about global turmoil have eased somewhat.

The University of Michigan final consumer sentiment index for September, released Friday, advanced to 87.2 from a 85.7 reading earlier this month. The early September reading was the lowest in a year. The latest...
